trans-unit.source: Gets the mouse cursor position relative to GUI window.

seg-source.mrk: Gets the mouse cursor position relative to GUI window.

target.mrk: Gets the mouse cursor position relative to GUI window.

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: [optional] The handle of the window to use. If omitted the "current" window will be used.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The handle of the window to use.
If omitted the "current" window will be used.

target.mrk: [optional]
The handle of the window to use.
If omitted the "current" window will be used.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: a five-element array that containing the mouse cursor information:

seg-source.mrk: a five-element array that containing the mouse cursor information:

target.mrk: a five-element array that containing the mouse cursor information:

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[0] = X coord (horizontal)

target.mrk: $aArray[0] = X coord (horizontal)

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[1] = Y coord (vertical)

target.mrk: $aArray[1] = Y coord (vertical)

trans-unit.source: $aArray[2] = Primary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[2] = Primary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

target.mrk: $aArray[2] = Primary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

trans-unit.source: $aArray[3] = Secondary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[3] = Secondary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

target.mrk: $aArray[3] = Secondary down (1 if pressed, 0 if not pressed)

trans-unit.source: $aArray[4] = ID of the control that the mouse cursor is hovering over (or 0 if none)

seg-source.mrk: $aArray[4] = ID of the control that the mouse cursor is hovering over (or 0 if none)

target.mrk: $aArray[4] = ID of the control that the mouse cursor is hovering over (or 0 if none)

seg-source.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The coordinates given are relative to the GUI window (known as client coords).

seg-source.mrk: The coordinates given are relative to the GUI window (known as client coords).

target.mrk: The coordinates given are relative to the GUI window (known as client coords).

trans-unit.source: If the "winhandle" parameter is used then the specified window becomes the new "current" window.

seg-source.mrk: If the "winhandle" parameter is used then the specified window becomes the new "current" window.

target.mrk: If the "winhandle" parameter is used then the specified window becomes the new "current" window.

trans-unit.source: The mouse cursor position is successful only on an window created by a GUICreate(). When no winhandle it will be successful if the GUI Windows is active.

seg-source.mrk: The mouse cursor position is successful only on an window created by a GUICreate().
When no winhandle it will be successful if the GUI Windows is active.

target.mrk: The mouse cursor position is successful only on an window created by a GUICreate().
When no winhandle it will be successful if the GUI Windows is active.

trans-unit.source: ListViewItem or TreeViewItem controlID will never be returned, only the parent Listview or TreeView control ID is.

seg-source.mrk: ListViewItem or TreeViewItem controlID will never be returned, only the parent Listview or TreeView control ID is.

target.mrk: ListViewItem or TreeViewItem controlID will never be returned, only the parent Listview or TreeView control ID is.

target.mrk: GetPos

target.mrk: Press Esc to Get Pos

seg-source.mrk: Loop until the user exits.

target.mrk: Loop until the user exits.
